results.title: The Dead bird
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A short story by Margaret Wise Brown which encourages young readers to expect a rewarding experience from reading and to write a story themselves from casual incidents in their own lives. The theme of the film, the dead bird, also lends itself to discussion about the naturalness of death, leading to an appraisal of the essential values in living

results.title: The Days the world went mad
results.creator_credit: Max Morgan-Witts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A documentary of natural disasters compiled from film footage gathered from all over the world. Earthquakes, tidal waves, eruptions, tornadoes and hurricanes are all recorded. Includes unique footage of the Alaskan earthquake.

results.title: The Daylight moon: a film about the poet Les Murray
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description: If there were such a thing, Les Murray would be the Poet Laureate of Australia. In this amusing, lyrical documentary, Don Featherstone has succeeded in capturing the essence of one of our finest poets, a man totally at home in the country round Bunyah N.S.W., farming for a living and writing poems. Interviews with the endearing Les Murray are interspersed with readings of his poems set to suitably beautiful images of the area and people which inspired them. Winner of the Gold Plaque, Chicago International Film Festival 1991.

results.title: The Day of the Concorde
results.brief_description: On 26 January 1976 Concorde carried its first paying passengers on a British Airways proving flight from Heathrow to Gander, Newfoundland. (An Air France Concorde took off at the same time, on a similar flight to Brazil.) This film captures this historic event, as the complement of VIP’s embark in the early morning and return in time for lunch.

results.title: The Day begins
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Keystone Film Company
results.brief_description: Unable to play his part, Charlie is thrown out of the movie studio. In his efforts to return he disguises himself as a woman, causing havoc for the film crew and landing him in deep water ending with a chase through the Keystone sets. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Roscoe (Fatty) Arbuckle, Charles Murray.

results.title: The Day after tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin, United Nations Television and University of the State of New York
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses the use of solar power, geothermal resources, and thermonuclear fusion as energy sources.

results.title: The Dawn of industry
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions, Gerard Bryant and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The history of the hovercraft’s development including an interview with its inventor, Christopher Cockerell. Various uses, both commercial and military, are shown, and some of its posible future applications are described.

results.title: The Dawn of Happiness
results.brief_description: A country as enigmatic as any in the Orient is the location for this adventure trip of a lifetime, where we see first hand the roots of modern Thailand. Starting in Bangkok, travel north upstream to Aeutia in the Chao Phraya River in search of the incredible Hill tribes of Northern Thailand, who are found in one of the most remote areas in the country between the borders of Burma and Laos. Upon arrival witness a wedding ceremony - a magnificent display of clothing and jewellery, highlighting the fascinating rituals and traditions of these ancient people. Further on the journey, visit Naoon Suan - one of the largest rice markets in the world, along with Subotai and Chiang Mai, two of the most fascinating cities in Thailand.

results.title: The Date
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley and O D N Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Acquaintance Rape”.
A young girl with an older boy come home after a date. They play out what they think of each other in their minds. The young man wants to go to bed with her, while she’s thinking about what a nice guy he is. She rejects him when he makes a pass at her. They argue, he slaps her and begins to harass her. The film stops there providing food for thought on the subject of sexual violence/sexual harassment.
